The news of the change rocked Silicon Valley, with analysts and company insiders offering varying theories. Some said Mr. Eric Schmidt was tired of the day-to-day hassles of management. Mr. Eric Schmidt said in the interview, I would tell you, frankly, a decade is a long time to be a C.E.O., and Larry will discover this. These results give us the optimism and confidence to invest heavily in future growth-- investments that will benefit our users, Google and the wider web. The company also announced that starting April 4, Larry Page, Google Co-Founder, will take charge of company's day-to-day operations as CEO. Eric Schmidt will assume the role of Executive Chairman.
